title: Obari
author: Obari
content: I've been reminiscing on this very topic above and I have gotten any straight answer from my head or mind and it really bothers me so much to see how people and things are easily forgotten like they never existed and to me it's an issue of concern.I was reading some old but gold topics on the forum and I see how much people has forgotten such topics like they were never written and same thing applies to human and the surrounding neighborhood.Why are people and things forgotten so soon?Please let's talk on this.N/B please if this not the right place for this topic, I will be glad if notified so I can move it to the right place or possibly move it for me.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: I think your post is fine here. In terms of people a lot aren't remembered well to begin with here (username placement is quite subtle and is often not the first thing you check - if you've not got a unique avatar I probably won't recognise you). The only other way I'll know who you are is if you provide some use/controversy enough that people quote you - or I think your posts are good. Historically, humans have had very little to remember concisely. Since agriculture, you have to remember how your land looks and how you'll recognise it when you return if you get lost and that's about it. Your brain wasn't designed to read a few hundred thousand words a day and retain it all. No one really knows how memory works too but I think we can all remember a time where we've thought of a memory we had no idea we knew or one that has spontaneously appeared (or both) and I get that a lot here. Am I going to edit a post I made 3 days or 3 months ago with a more detailed response? Will it even be read if I do? (this is a thought of mine I have quite often so if you have thoughts I want them).Some people get comfortable too. History proves that more advanced things generally replace less advanced ones, no one looks at it as proving anytbing they don't want it to (such as the Mt Gox and ftx saga and all the other identical instances).

comments.author: Stepstowealth
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on December 03, 2022, 06:37:36 AMWhy are people and things forgotten so soon?People are only remembered for what they did while they were alive, while things are only remembered for as long as they are functional. As a human, to be remembered, you do not have to do what everyone is doing, you have to be special to leave a mark so that people will celebrate you for what you did. People who did nothing and had no influence are quickly forgotten, just like things that go bad and cannot be fixed.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Human beings are simple creatures, we are still not too far removed from the ape. Man is really not that different to what it was a very, very long time ago. Our brain has developed but our long term memory really is not that great, we need constant stimulation & reminders to be able to recall some events.I am obviously not a neurologist but recent events obviously are fresh in the memory. Past events are more difficult to remember as clearly as something which was last week for example.

comments.body: Good memory depends mostly from your age. If you take B vitamins twice a year and enough sleep at nights, you can have better memory with time. For bad memory there are also prescription drugs.

comments.author: speedy963
comments.body: IMO, no matter what happens life always move forward, and even if we do remember them by specific moments it is also true that we live with those memories. It's not that we forget them but we only learn to live without them. This is also one of the reasons why we have "history", to record the things in order for us not to forget it or for reference in our future decisions, or actions.

People lose interest in old topics that were once important to them as it is human nature to forget about things that are no longer important.In this technological world everyone is occupied with social media, technology, and gadgets, which have made life easier for us. However, these advancements have increased distances in our relationships. Our memory mainly operates in short-term mode and our ability to store past events has reduced drastically. This is the main reason for forgetting things and people.

comments.author: Kelward
comments.body: People forget old things because they move on to new things, except there's something or an event that will make them to remember the past, I think that is human nature, if we keep occupying our minds with old things and the past, then we can't function well in new things and present events. If you lose a loved one, the experience will be very painful during that period, but eventually you'll move on, except there's a memorial for the deacesed, him or her will be forgotten as time goes on, this is why history and achaive is very important so we can look back and remember important events that concerns us.
